content: Since this seems a beta issue, please report it at the beta forum, which is at https://thunderbird.topicbox.com/groups/beta Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: Grazie mille per la risposta, quello che dovrei fare ora è quindi fare i backup di tutti gli indirizzi email (che include anche le cartelle locali create giusto?), disinstallare Thunderbird e poi reinstallarlo?
creator: justice.madufor

content:
Le versioni recenti di Thunderbird sono: 45, 52, 60, 68, 78, 91 e 102. Tutte le versioni intermedie sono da considerarsi sperimentali (beta).

Tutte le edizioni di Thunderbird sono scaricabili da qui -> https://archive.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/ scegliendo prima la versione, poi il sistema operativo ed infine la lingua

Avresti però dovuto fare un backup prima dell'aggiornamento. Adesso potrebbe essere tardi. Ecco comunque come procedere https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo

Infine tieni conto che tornare ad una vecchia versione richiede alcune accortezze descritte qui -> https://gioxx.org/2021/08/04/impossibile-utilizzare-il-profilo-avviando-una-versione-precedente-di-thunderbird/ -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-dedicati-installazione-thunderbird#w_cosa-succede-a-un-profilo-se-si-retrocede-thunderbird-a-una-versione-precedente

(nella prima guida c'è un piccolo refuso, il comando non è -allow-downgrade ma - -allow-downgrade con due trattini iniziali)
creator: @next

content:
Will, Thank you for responding. I am not sure what to do with this information. As I said in my original post, it happened, abruptly, Tuesday night (20 June 2023). I have not changed any settings in Thunderbird since I installed it months ago. Plus, my iMac, iPhone, and iPad Pro are sending and receiving emails perfectly, as they have been doing for several years.

It is only Thunderbird on my Windows 10 PC that is having a problem sending emails. My internet/email provider, Spectrum (Charter Communications) verified they had not made any changes to the email server that would have affected my ability to send emails.

Since my Apple computer and mobile devices are unaffected and still handle send/receive emails as always, it comes down to either my provider, Spectrum, or Thunderbird. I find it strange that all of a sudden, Thunderbird can not send email.

I still do not know what I need to do to correct this problem.

Thank you,

Randy
creator: chayes23

content:
This error occurs when the SMTP server blocks the messages. This may also happen when sending messages is blocked by ISP restrictions to outgoing ports and mark them as spam. To send and receive emails SMTP is used as an internet standard by the users.

Regards, Will
creator: willjoe24421
